title: ADC
description: A declarative configuration for an ADC such as F5 BIG-IP

class.title: Class

$schema.description: URL of schema against which to validate. Used by validation in your local environment only (via Visual Studio Code, for example)

updateMode.title: Update mode
updateMode.description: When set to 'selective' (default) BIG-IP AS3 does not modify Tenants not referenced in the declaration.  Otherwise ('complete') BIG-IP AS3 removes unreferenced Tenants.

schemaVersion.title: Schema version
schemaVersion.description: Version of ADC Declaration schema this declaration uses
schemaVersion.$comment: IMPORTANT: In enum array, please put current schema version first, oldest-supported version last.  Keep enum array sorted most-recent-first.

hostname.description: Host name of managed device to be configured

constants.title: Constants

timestamp.title: Declaration timestamp
timestamp.description: Date+time (this version of) declaration was created (optional but recommended)

allowReuse.title: Allow reuse
allowReuse.description: If true (default), different declaration objects may reuse a cryptogram, WHICH MAY POSE A SECURITY RISK!

Common.title: Common tenant
Common.description: Special tenant Common holds objects other tenants can share

verifiers.title: Verifiers
verifiers.description: Data (in 'key':'value' properties) used to verify automated tests.  Ordinary declarations do not need this

enable.title: Enable
enable.description: If declared, you must enable the Common tenant

optimisticLockKey.title: Optimistic lock key
optimisticLockKey.description: When you deploy a declaration with a non-empty 'key' value here, that activates an optimistic lock on changes to this Tenant.  If the key in your declaration does not match the key BIG-IP AS3 computes for the most-recent previous declaration, then BIG-IP AS3 will NOT update this Tenant and will return an error code.  To use optimistic locking, first retrieve a declaration using option 'showHash=true' to get the current per-Tenant keys.  Make any changes you desire, then deploy your updated declaration.  Deployment of each Tenant with a key will succeed only if that Tenant has not been modified since the time you retrieved the declaration.  (To overwrite all previous changes to a Tenant simply do NOT include any opportunistic-lock key for that Tenant when you deploy a declaration.  That is the default.)  Note that only keys computed by BIG-IP AS3 may be used here-- you cannot generate your own. If 'showHash=true' is used on a POST then the optimisticLockKey will be shown as a part of the output (This helps to avoid the need to do a GET request).

scratch.title: f5 scratch
scratch.description: Holds some system data during declaration processing

Include.title: Include
Include.description: Defines inclusion of one part of the schema into another

include.description: Keyword to allow for inclusion of one part of the declaration into another

verifiers.title: Verifiers
verifiers.description: Data (in 'key':'value' properties) used to verify automated tests.  Ordinary declarations do not need this

enable.title: Enable
enable.description: Tenant handles traffic only when enabled (default)

defaultRouteDomain.title: Default route domain
defaultRouteDomain.description: Using the route-domain ID, this property selects the default route domain for IP traffic to and from this Tenant's application resources (note: affects declared IP addresses which do not include a %RD route-domain specifier).  You must choose an existing route domain--this option cannot create one.  Route domain 0 (default) is always available
defaultRouteDomain.$comment: TMSH forces this value to be an integer

optimisticLockKey.title: Optimistic lock key
optimisticLockKey.description: When you deploy a declaration with a non-empty 'key' value here, that activates an optimistic lock on changes to this Tenant.  If the key in your declaration does not match the key BIG-IP AS3 computes for the most-recent previous declaration, then BIG-IP AS3 will NOT update this Tenant and will return an error code.  To use optimistic locking, first retrieve a declaration using option 'showHash=true' to get the current per-Tenant keys.  Make any changes you desire, then deploy your updated declaration.  Deployment of each Tenant with a key will succeed only if that Tenant has not been modified since the time you retrieved the declaration.  (To overwrite all previous changes to a Tenant simply do NOT include any opportunistic-lock key for that Tenant when you deploy a declaration.  That is the default.)  Note that only keys computed by BIG-IP AS3 may be used here-- you cannot generate your own. If 'showHash=true' is used on a POST then the optimisticLockKey will be shown as a part of the output (This helps to avoid the need to do a GET request).

Service_Core.title: Virtual-server core
Service_Core.description: Core attributes of a virtual server

virtualAddresses.title: Virtual addresses
virtualAddresses.description: Accepts either an array or a reference to an Address_List which contains destination addresses to which this virtual will listen. To accept connections only from certain subnet(s), replace IP address in the provided array with array [IP-address, accept-from-subnet]. If you do this, you cannot also include the sourceAddress property. IP address in the provided array can also be replaced by a reference to a Service_Address. A reference to an Address_List is only supported on BIG-IP 14.1 and later. If an Address_List is provided, BIG-IP AS3 will create a traffic-matching-criteria for the virtual.

serviceDownImmediateAction.title: Service Down Immediate Action
serviceDownImmediateAction.description: Specifies the immediate action the BIG-IP system should respond with upon the receipt of the initial client's SYN packet if the availability status of the virtual server is Offline or Unavailable. This is supported for the virtual server of Standard type and TCP protocol. The default value is none.

shareAddresses.title: Share addresses
shareAddresses.description: A user set boolean that indicates whether the virtualAddresses should be added to or checked for /Common instead of the tenant. This value defaults to false, and so will put the virtualAddresses into their tenant.

sourceAddress.title: Source address
sourceAddress.description: Accepts either a string or a reference to an Address_List which contains source addresses from which this virtual will listen. A reference to an Address_List is only supported on BIG-IP 14.1 and later. If an Address_List is provided, BIG-IP AS3 will create a traffic-matching-criteria for the virtual. If you also include the virtualAddresses property, those addresses cannot include the accept-from-subnet field.

adminState.description: Specifies the state of the Service. When set to disable the Service no longer accepts new connection requests, but will allow current connections to finish processing before going to a down state.

spanningEnabled.description: Enable all BIG-IP systems in device group to listen for and process traffic on the same virtual address

SNAT_Translation.description: Configures explicit secure network address translation (SNAT) address

address.title: Address

adminState.description: Specifies the state of the SNAT translation

arpEnabled.title: Enable ARP
arpEnabled.description: Specifies that the NAT sends ARP requests

ipIdleTimeout.title: IP Idle Timeout
ipIdleTimeout.description: Specifies time in seconds that connections to an IP address initiated using a SNAT address are allowed to remain idle before being automatically disconnected. Specifying 'indefinite' prevents the connection from timing out.

maxConnections.title: Maximum Connections
maxConnections.description: Specifies a limit on the number of connections a translation address must reach before it no longer initiates a connection. A value of 0 indicates the setting is disabled.

tcpIdleTimeout.title: TCP Idle Timeout
tcpIdleTimeout.description: Specifies time in seconds that TCP connections initiated using a SNAT address are allowed to remain idle before being automatically disconnected. Specifying 'indefinite' prevents the connection from timing out.

trafficGroup.title: Traffic Group
trafficGroup.description: Specifies the traffic group which the SNAT_Translation belongs

udpIdleTimeout.title: UDP Idle Timeout
udpIdleTimeout.description: Specifies time in seconds that UDP connections initiated using a SNAT address are allowed to remain idle before being automatically disconnected. Specifying 'indefinite' prevents the connection from timing out.

WAF_Policy.title: WAF_Policy
WAF_Policy.description: A Web Application Firewall Policy. Supports both traditional and advanced WAF policies. Advanced WAF policies require TMOS version 16.0 or newer.

url.title: URL
url.description: The URL to pull the ASM policy from

file.title: File
file.description: The absolute file path for the ASM policy stored on the BIG-IP

ignoreChanges.title: Ignore changes
ignoreChanges.description: If false (default), the system updates the policy in every BIG-IP AS3 declaration deployment. If true, BIG-IP AS3 creates the policy on first deployment, and leaves it untouched afterwards

enforcementMode.title: Enforcement Mode
enforcementMode.description: Overrides the enforcement mode setting of the WAF policy. Ignored on Advanced WAF policies

serverTechnologies.title: Server Technologies
serverTechnologies.description: Define server technologies for the WAF Policy, such as Java Servlets or Apache Struts. Ignored on Advanced WAF policies

disabledSignatures.title: Disabled attack signatures
disabledSignatures.description: Disable various attack signatures by ID. Ignored on Advanced WAF policies

expand.title: Expand
expand.description: Performs AS3 string expansion on specified values within the WAF Policy. WAF Policies that are not in JSON format will be ignored

items.title: JSON pointer
items.description: A JSON pointer to a value within the WAF Policy that requires AS3 string expansion. Pointing to a parent property results in AS3 traversing the sub-properties and expanding any strings that it may find

matchAcrossVirtualPorts.title: Match across virtual ports
matchAcrossVirtualPorts.description: Specifies that all persistent connections from a client IP address that go to the same virtual IP address also go to the same node

matchAcrossVirtualAddresses.title: Match across virtual addresses

overrideConnectionLimit.title: Override connection limit

hashAlgorithm.description: Specifies the algorithm the system uses for hash persistence load balancing. The hash result is the input for the algorithm.

addressMask.title: Address mask
addressMask.description: Optional mask selects portion of address used by simple persistence (if omitted the system uses all address bits)

Monitor_Inband.description: Additional Monitor class properties available when monitorType = inband

failureInterval.title: Failure Interval
failureInterval.description: Specifies an interval, in seconds. If the number of failures specified in the failures option occurs within this interval, the system marks the pool member as being unavailable.

failures.title: Failures
failures.description: Specifies the number of failures that the system allows to occur, within the time period specified in the failureInterval property, before marking a pool member unavailable. The multiple tmm processes use a per-process number to calculate failures, depending on the specified load. For example, for the Round Robin load balancing method, if there are N tmm processes and M pool members, and the Failures property is set to L, then up to N*M*L+1 failures can occur before the system marks the node as down. Specifying a value of 0 disables this option. A failure can be either a failure to connect or a failure of the pool member to respond within the time specified in the responseTime property.

responseTime.title: Response Time
responseTime.description: Specifies an amount of time, in seconds. If the pool member does not respond with data after the specified amount of time has passed, the number of failures in this interval increments by 1. Specifying a value of 0 disables this option.

retryTime.title: Retry Time
retryTime.description: Specifies the amount of time in seconds after the pool member has been marked unavailable before the system retries to connect to the pool member. Specifying a value of 0 disables this option.

cacheCertificateEnabled.description: Enables or disables (default) caching certificates by IP address and port number

c3dOCSPUnknownStatusAction.description: Specifies the BIG-IP action when the OCSP returns unknown status. The default is drop

c3dOCSP.description: Specifies SSL Client Certificate Constrained Delegation (C3D) OCSP object that the BIG-IP SSL should use to connect to the OCSP responder and check the client certificate status

forwardProxyBypassEnabled.title: Forward Proxy Bypass Enabled
forwardProxyBypassEnabled.description: Enables or disables (default) SSL forward proxy bypass

forwardProxyBypassAllowlist.title: Forward Proxy Bypass Allowlist
forwardProxyBypassAllowlist.description: Specifies the data group name of hostname allowlist when both SSL forwardProxyEnabled & forwardProxyBypassEnabled features are set to true.

ldapStartTLS.title: Client-LDAP Profile
ldapStartTLS.description: Creates a client LDAP profile with the specified activation mode STARTTLS.

smtpsStartTLS.title: Simple Mail Transfer Protocol Security (SMTPS) profile
smtpsStartTLS.description: Creates a SMTPS profile with the specified activation mode STARTTTLS. Because HTTP profile is not compatible with SMTPS use with Service_TCP instead of Service_HTTPS. Also incompatible with ldapStartTLS. Use only one of the two.

staplerOCSPEnabled.description: Specifies whether to enable OCSP stapling

insertEmptyFragmentsEnabled.title: Insert Empty Fragments Enabled
insertEmptyFragmentsEnabled.description: Enables a countermeasure against an SSL 3.0/TLS 1.0 protocol vulnerability affecting CBC ciphers. These ciphers cannot be handled by certain broken SSL implementations.

singleUseDhEnabled.title: Single Use DH Enabled
singleUseDhEnabled.description: Creates a new key when using temporary/ephemeral DH parameters. This option must be used to prevent small subgroup attacks, when the DH parameters were not generated using strong primes (for example. when using DSA-parameters). If strong primes were used, it is not strictly necessary to generate a new DH key during each handshake, but F5 Networks recommends it. Enable the Single DH Use option whenever temporary or ephemeral DH parameters are used.

tls1_3Enabled.title: TLS 1.3
tls1_3Enabled.description: Allow TLS 1.3 Protocol. Note: tls1_3Enabled is only supported in tmos version 14.0+.

renegotiationEnabled.title: Renegotiation
renegotiationEnabled.description: Controls on a per-connection basis how the system responds to mid-stream SSL reconnection requests.

retainCertificateEnabled.title: Retain Certificate
retainCertificateEnabled.description: When enabled, server certificate is retained in SSL session.

namingScheme.description: Scheme to use when naming generated tmsh configuration

proxySslEnabled.title: Proxy SSL Enabled
proxySslEnabled.description: When enabled, further modification of application traffic within an SSL tunnel is allowed while still allowing the server to perform necessary authorization, authentication, and auditing steps. Requires a corresponding TLS_Client with this enabled to perform transparent SSL decryption.

proxySslPassthroughEnabled.title: Proxy SSL Passthrough Enabled
proxySslPassthroughEnabled.description: When enabled, it allows Proxy SSL to passthrough the traffic when ciphersuite negotiated between the client and server is not supported. Requires a corresponding TLS_Client with this enabled to perform transparent SSL decryption.

secureRenegotiation.title: Secure Renegotiation
secureRenegotiation.description: Specifies the secure renegotiation mode. When set to require, any client attempting to renegotiate that does not support secure renegotiation will have its connection aborted. When set to require-strict, any client attempting to connect that does not support secure renegotiation will have its initial handshake denied. When set to request, unpatched clients will be permitted to renegotiate. Setting to request is not recommended as it is subject to active man-in-the-middle attacks.

uncleanShutdownEnabled.title: Unclean Shutdown Enabled
uncleanShutdownEnabled.description: When enabled, the profile performs unclean shutdowns of all SSL connections, which means the underlying TCP connections are closed without exchanging the required SSL shutdown alerts.

certificateExtensions.title: Certificate Extensions
certificateExtensions.description: Specifies the extensions of the web server certificates to be included in the generated certificates using SSL Forward Proxy.

nonSslConnectionsEnabled.title: Allow Non-SSL Connections
nonSslConnectionsEnabled.description: Specifies if non-SSL connections are allowed.

allowDynamicRecordSizing.title: Allow Dynamic Record Sizing
allowDynamicRecordSizing.description: Enables or disables dynamic application record sizing.

dataZeroRoundTripTime.title: Data Zero Round Trip Time
dataZeroRoundTripTime.description: Specifies if TLSv1.3 should accept 0-RTT with early data, with or without anti-replay. To protect against packet replay, F5 recommends that you enable anti-replay. The default value is disabled, which means TLSv1.3 will discard any early data.

renegotiateMaxRecordDelay.title: Renegotiate Max Record Delay
renegotiateMaxRecordDelay.description: Specifies the maximum number of SSL records that the traffic management system can receive before it renegotiates an SSL session. After the system receives this number of SSL records, it closes the connection. This setting applies to client profiles only.

renegotiatePeriod.title: Renegotiate Period
renegotiatePeriod.description: Specifies the number of seconds required to renegotiate an SSL session.

renegotiateSize.title: Renegotiate Size
renegotiateSize.description: Specifies the size of the application data, in megabytes, that is transmitted over the secure channel. If the size of the data is higher than this value, the traffic management system must renegotiate the SSL session.

sslSignHash.title: SSL Sign Hash
sslSignHash.description: Specifies SSL sign hash algorithm which is used to sign and verify SSL Server Key Exchange and Certificate Verify messages for the specified SSL profiles.

sniDefault.title: Default SNI
sniDefault.description: When true, this profile is the default SSL profile when a client connection does not specify a known server name, or does not specify any server name at all. The default value is false

requireSNI.title: Require SNI
requireSNI.description: When a client sends no or unknown SNI and Require SNI is false (default), the system uses the primary certificate, otherwise the system rejects the client

alertTimeout.title: Alert Timeout
alertTimeout.description: Specifies the duration of time, in seconds, for the system to try to close an SSL connection before resetting the connection. The default is 'indefinite'. You can also specify 'immediate', or an integer.

ciphers.title: Ciphers
ciphers.description: Ciphersuite selection string. ciphers and cipherGroup are mutually exclusive, only use one.

cipherGroup.description: Pointer to a cipherGroup. cipherGroup and ciphers are mutually exclusive, only use one.

validateCertificate.description: If false (default) accept any cert from server, else validate server cert against trusted CA bundle

bigip.title: BIG-IP CA bundle

ignoreExpired.description: If false (default) drop connections with expired server certificates

ignoreUntrusted.title: Ignored untrusted
ignoreUntrusted.description: If false (default) drop connections with untrusted server certificates

sessionTickets.title: Session tickets
sessionTickets.description: If false (default) do not use rfc5077 session tickets

clientCertificate.title: Client certificate
clientCertificate.description: BIG-IP AS3 pointer to client Certificate declaration (optional)

crlFile.title: Certificate Revocation List (CRL) File
crlFile.description: Specifies the name of a file containing a list of revoked client certificates

allowExpiredCRL.title: Allow Expired CRL
allowExpiredCRL.description: Specifies if the CRL can be used even if it has expired

c3dCertificateAuthority.title: C3D Certificate Authority
c3dCertificateAuthority.description: Pointer to a Certificate class which specifies the Certificate Authority values for C3D

c3dCertificateExtensions.title: C3D Certificate Extensions
c3dCertificateExtensions.description: Specifies the custom extension OID of the client certificates to be included in the generated certificates using SSL C3D

c3dCertificateLifespan.title: C3D Certificate Lifespan
c3dCertificateLifespan.description: Specifies the lifespan of the certificate generated using the SSL client certificate constrained delegation

c3dEnabled.title: C3D Enabled
c3dEnabled.description: Enables or disables SSL Client certificate constrained delegation (C3D). Using C3D eliminates the need for requiring users to provide credentials twice for certain authentication actions

forwardProxyEnabled.title: Forward Proxy Enabled
forwardProxyEnabled.description: Enables or disables (default) SSL forward proxy

forwardProxyBypassEnabled.title: Forward Proxy Bypass Enabled
forwardProxyBypassEnabled.description: Enables or disables (default) SSL forward proxy bypass

ldapStartTLS.title: Server-LDAP Profile
ldapStartTLS.description: Creates a client LDAP profile with the specified activation mode STARTTLS.

insertEmptyFragmentsEnabled.title: Insert Empty Fragments Enabled
insertEmptyFragmentsEnabled.description: Enables a countermeasure against an SSL 3.0/TLS 1.0 protocol vulnerability affecting CBC ciphers. These ciphers cannot be handled by certain broken SSL implementations.

singleUseDhEnabled.title: Single Use DH Enabled
singleUseDhEnabled.description: Creates a new key when using temporary/ephemeral DH parameters. This option must be used to prevent small subgroup attacks, when the DH parameters were not generated using strong primes (for example. when using DSA-parameters). If strong primes were used, it is not strictly necessary to generate a new DH key during each handshake, but F5 Networks recommends it. Enable the Single DH Use option whenever temporary or ephemeral DH parameters are used.

tls1_3Enabled.title: TLS 1.3
tls1_3Enabled.description: Allow TLS 1.3 Ciphers. Note: tls1_3Enabled is only supported in tmos version 14.0+.

renegotiationEnabled.title: Renegotiation
renegotiationEnabled.description: Controls on a per-connection basis how the system responds to mid-stream SSL reconnection requests.

retainCertificateEnabled.title: Retain Certificate
retainCertificateEnabled.description: When enabled, server certificate is retained in SSL session.

proxySslEnabled.title: Proxy SSL Enabled
proxySslEnabled.description: When enabled, further modification of application traffic within an SSL tunnel is allowed while still allowing the server to perform necessary authorization, authentication, and auditing steps. Requires a corresponding TLS_Server with this enabled to perform transparent SSL decryption.

proxySslPassthroughEnabled.title: Proxy SSL Passthrough Enabled
proxySslPassthroughEnabled.description: When enabled, it allows Proxy SSL to passthrough the traffic when ciphersuite negotiated between the client and server is not supported. Requires a corresponding TLS_Server with this enabled to perform transparent SSL decryption.

secureRenegotiation.title: Secure Renegotiation
secureRenegotiation.description: Specifies the secure renegotiation mode. When set to require, any connection to an unpatched server will be aborted. For TLS_Client, require and require-strict are the same. When set to request, connections to unpatched servers will be permitted. Setting to request is not recommended as it is subject to active man-in-the-middle attacks.

uncleanShutdownEnabled.title: Unclean Shutdown Enabled
uncleanShutdownEnabled.description: When enabled, the profile performs unclean shutdowns of all SSL connections, which means the underlying TCP connections are closed without exchanging the required SSL shutdown alerts.

dataZeroRoundTripTime.title: Data Zero Round Trip Time
dataZeroRoundTripTime.description: Specifies if TLSv1.3 should send 0-RTT early data when available.

renegotiatePeriod.title: Renegotiate Period
renegotiatePeriod.description: Specifies the number of seconds from the initial connect time after which the system renegotiates an SSL session. The default value is indefinite, which means that you do not want the system to renegotiate SSL sessions.

renegotiateSize.title: Renegotiate Size
renegotiateSize.description: Specifies a throughput size, in megabytes, of SSL renegotiation. This option forces the traffic management system to renegotiate an SSL session based on the size, in megabytes, of application data that is transmitted over the secure channel. The default value is indefinite, which specifies that you do not want a throughput size.

sslSignHash.title: SSL Sign Hash
sslSignHash.description: Specifies SSL sign hash algorithm which is used to sign and verify SSL Server Key Exchange and Certificate Verify messages for the specified SSL profiles.

Sender_Tag_Mapping.title: Sender and Tag Data Group Mapping
Sender_Tag_Mapping.description: Establishes a mapping between a sender value and data group containing tag substitution values

use.title: Use
use.description: BIG-IP AS3 pointer to data group if any (declared separately)

bigip.title: BIG-IP data group
bigip.description: Pathname of existing BIG-IP data group

isExternal.title: External data group
isExternal.description: Toggles whether existing data group is internal or external

FIX_Profile.title: FIX_Profile
FIX_Profile.description: Configures a Financial Information eXchange Protocol (FIX) profile

parentProfile.description: Specifies the name of the profile object to inherit the settings from

fullLogonParsingEnabled.title: Fully Parse Logon Message
fullLogonParsingEnabled.description: Enables or disables logon message as always fully parsed. Other messages are parsed according to the configuration of Quick Parsing

messageLogPublisher.title: Message Log Publisher
messageLogPublisher.description: Specifies the publisher for message logging

reportLogPublisher.description: Specifies the publisher for error messages and status reports

quickParsingEnabled.title: Quick Parsing
quickParsingEnabled.description: Enables or disables quick parsing which parses the basic standard fields and validates message length and checksum

responseParsingEnabled.title: Response Parsing
responseParsingEnabled.description: Enables or disables response parsing which parses the messages from the FIX server. Applies the same parser configuration and error handling at server side as at client side. If not enabled, server side messages are directly passed through

statisticsSampleInterval.title: Statistics Sample Interval
statisticsSampleInterval.description: Specifies the sample interval of the message rate in seconds

senderTagMappingList.title: Sender and Tag Substitution Mapping
senderTagMappingList.description: Specifies the mappings between sender ID and tag substitution data group.

idleTimeout.title: Idle Timeout
idleTimeout.description: The number of seconds that a Real-time Transport Protocol (RTP) connection is idle before the connection is eligible for deletion

maxHeaderSize.title: Maximum Header Size
maxHeaderSize.description: The largest RTSP request or response header, in bytes, that the RTSP filter accepts before dropping the connection

maxQueuedData.title: Maximum Queued Data
maxQueuedData.description: The maximum amount of data, in bytes, that the RTSP filter buffers before dropping the connection

unicastRedirect.title: Unicast Redirect
unicastRedirect.description: When enabled specifies that the client can select the destination port for the streamed data. The destination address for the data is the source of the request.

multicastRedirect.title: Multicast Redirect
multicastRedirect.description: When enabled, if you are using multicast streams, specifies that the client has permission to supply a different destination IP address for the streamed data

sessionReconnect.title: Session Reconnect
sessionReconnect.description: When enabled specifies that the system persists a resumed control connection to the correct server. Typical clients do not support this behavior.

realHTTPPersistence.title: Real HTTP Persistence
realHTTPPersistence.description: When enabled specifies that the system automatically persists Real Networks-tunneled RTSP data over HTTP, which is over the RTSP port. When disabled, a user can override the default behavior with an iRule.

checkSource.title: Check Source
checkSource.description: When true the system uses the source attribute in the transport header to establish the target address of the RTP stream, and before the response is forwarded to the client, updates the value of the source attribute to be the virtual address of the BIG-IP system. When false the system does not change the source attribute.

proxy.title: Proxy
proxy.description: Specifies whether the RTSP profile is associated with an RTSP proxy configuration

proxyHeader.title: Proxy Header
proxyHeader.description: When set, specifies the name of the header in the RTSP proxy configuration that is passed from the client-side virtual server to the server-side virtual server. Note that the name of the header must begin with X-. To use the proxyHeader option, you must specify a value for the proxy option. Note that the system removes this header from the request prior to sending the request to the server for processing.

RTPPort.title: RTP Port
RTPPort.description: The number of the port to use for the RTP service

RTCPPort.title: RTCP Port
RTCPPort.description: The number of the port to use for the Real Time Control Protocol (RTCP) service. RTCP allows monitoring of real-time data delivery.

SIP_Profile.title: SIP_Profile
SIP_Profile.description: Configures a profile you can use to manage Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) traffic.

Statistics_Profile.title: Statistics Profile
Statistics_Profile.description: User-defined statistics fields. This object assigns field names for up to 32 fields. You can then use these field names from an iRule to record values.

^field(3[0-2]|[1-2][0-9]|[1-9])$.title: Field Name
^field(3[0-2]|[1-2][0-9]|[1-9])$.description: This regular expression represents 32 field properties named 'field1' through 'field32'.

idleTimeout.description: Specifies an idle timeout in seconds. This setting specifies the number of seconds that a connection is idle before the connection is eligible for deletion.

port.description: Specifies a service for the data channel port used for this profile

ftpsMode.description: Specifies the policy for explicit FTPS negotiation on FTP command channel

enforceTlsSessionReuseEnabled.description: Enforce data connection to reuse TLS session

activeModeEnabled.description: Specifies if the profile should allow FTP active transfer mode

securityEnabled.description: Specifies whether to enable or disable secure FTP traffic for the BIG-IP Application Security Manager

translateExtendedEnabled.description: Specifies if the profile should automatically translate RFC2428 extended requests EPSV and EPRT to PASV and PORT when communicating with IPv4servers

inheritParentProfileEnabled.description: Specifies if the FTP data channel should inherit the TCP profile used by the control channel

HTML_Rule_Match_Attribute_Optional.title: HTML_Rule_Match_Attribute_Optional
HTML_Rule_Match_Attribute_Optional.description: Matches on the specified tag name, attribute name, and attribute value. Attribute name and value are optional.

match.title: Match
match.description: Properties the rule is to match

HTML_Rule_Match_Attribute_Required.title: HTML_Rule_Match_Attribute_Required
HTML_Rule_Match_Attribute_Required.description: Matches on the specified tag name, attribute name, and attribute value. Attribute name and value are required.

match.title: Match
match.description: Properties the rule is to match

HTML_Rule_TagAppendHTML.title: Append HTML HTML_Rule
HTML_Rule_TagAppendHTML.description: Matches on the specified tag name and optional attribute name and attribute value, and then appends the specified HTML content to the tag delimiter.

content.title: Content
content.description: HTML content to append to tag delimiter

HTML_Rule_TagPrependHTML.title: HTML_Rule_TagPrependHTML
HTML_Rule_TagPrependHTML.description: Matches on the specified tag name and optional attribute name and attribute value, and then prepends the specified HTML content to the tag delimiter.

content.title: Content
content.description: HTML content to prepend to tag delimiter

HTML_Rule_TagRaiseEvent.title: HTML_Rule_TagRaiseEvent
HTML_Rule_TagRaiseEvent.description: Matches on the specified tag name and optional attribute name and attribute value, and then raises an event.

HTML_Rule_TagRemove.title: HTML_Rule_TagRemove
HTML_Rule_TagRemove.description: Matches on the specified tag name and optional attribute name and attribute value, and then removes the tag.

HTML_Rule_TagRemoveAttribute.title: Append HTML HTML_Rule
HTML_Rule_TagRemoveAttribute.description: Matches on the specified tag name, attribute name, and attribute value, and then removes a specified attribute. Tag name, attribute name, and value are required.

attributeName.title: Attriute Name
attributeName.description: Name of the attribute to be removed

contentDetectionEnabled.title: Content Detection Enabled
contentDetectionEnabled.description: Scans initial HTTP payload to look for HTML signatures and enables HTML profile if HTML-like patterns are detected

contentSelection.title: Content Selection
contentSelection.description: Matches content-type from response header against a list of the content-types and enables HTML profile if a match is found

rules.title: HTML Rules
rules.description: HTML Rules followed by the profile

masking.title: Masking
masking.description: Specifies the masking operation for WebSocket frames

compressMode.title: Compress Mode
compressMode.description: Available when TMOS version is 16.1 or newer. Specifies the mode that controls what compression operations are performed. Setting 'masking' to 'preserve' and 'compressMode' to 'typed' will not be allowed because it results in an invalid configuration.

compression.title: Compression
compression.description: Available when TMOS version is 16.1 or newer and used when compressMode is 'typed'. Specifies whether compress will be negotiated with the endpoint.

maximumWindowSize.title: Maximum Window Size
maximumWindowSize.description: Available when TMOS version is 16.1 or newer and used when compressMode is 'typed'. Specifies the maximum sliding window for compression negotiated with the endpoint.

noDelay.title: No Delay
noDelay.description: Available when TMOS version is 16.1 or newer and used when compressMode is 'typed'. Specifies whether data should be buffered for efficient compression, or compressed without delay.

sourceMask.title: Source Address Mask
sourceMask.description: Idle connection re-use applies to connections whose source address matches this mask

maxConnections.title: Maximum Connections
maxConnections.description: Specifies the maximum number of connections that the system holds in the connection reuse pool.

maxConnectionAge.title: Maximum Connection Age
maxConnectionAge.description: Specifies the maximum age, in number of seconds, of a connection in the connection reuse pool.

maxConnectionReuse.title: Maximum Connection Reuse
maxConnectionReuse.description: Specifies the maximum number of times that a server connection can be reused.

idleTimeoutOverride.title: Idle Timeout Override
idleTimeoutOverride.description: Specifies the number of seconds that a connection is idle before the connection flow is eligible for deletion.

connectionLimitEnforcement.title: Connection Limit Enforcement
connectionLimitEnforcement.description: When the limit is 'none', simultaneous in-flight requests and responses over TCP connections to a pool member are counted toward the limit. When the limit is 'idle', idle connections will be dropped as the TCP connection limit is reached. When the limit is 'strict', idle connections will prevent new TCP connections from being made until they expire (not recommended).

sharePools.title: Share Pools
sharePools.description: Indicates that TCP connections for the current pool may be shared among similar virtual servers using the same pool.

protocolVersions.description: Specifies the SOCKS protocol versions that are supported

resolver.title: DNS resolver
resolver.description: BIG-IP AS3 pointer to DNS resolver used to resolve hostnames in connect requests

bigip.title: BIG-IP resolver
bigip.description: Pathname of existing BIG-IP net DNS resolver

ipv6First.title: IPv6 first priority
ipv6First.description: Specifies the relative order of IPv4 and IPv6 DNS resolutions for URIs. If false (default), then the system performs IPv4 lookup before IPv6.

routeDomain.description: The route domain that will be used for outbound connect requests

tunnelName.title: Tunnel name
tunnelName.description: Name of tunnel used for outbound connect requests

defaultConnectAction.title: Default Connect Action
defaultConnectAction.description: Specifies the behavior of the proxy service for connect requests. If set to 'deny', connect requests will only be honored if there is another virtual server listening for the requested outbound connection. If set to 'allow' outbound connection will be made ragardless of other virtual servers.

TCP_Profile.title: TCP_Profile
TCP_Profile.description: Configures a Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) profile
TCP_Profile.$comment: Configures TCP settings. When deployed on BIG-IP, defaults match f5-tcp-progressive.

abc.title: Appropriate Byte Counting
abc.description: If true (default), BIG-IP AS3 adjusts the congestion window per rfc3465

ackOnPush.title: ACK on PSH
ackOnPush.description: If true (default), the system immediately acknowledges segments with the PSH flag set

autoProxyBufferSize.title: Automatic proxy-buffer size
autoProxyBufferSize.description: If true (default), BIG-IP AS3 adjusts the proxy buffer size automatically to optimize throughput

autoReceiveWindowSize.title: Automatic receive-window size
autoReceiveWindowSize.description: If true (default), BIG-IP AS3 adjusts the receive window size automatically to optimize throughput

autoSendBufferSize.title: Automatic send-buffer size
autoSendBufferSize.description: If true (default), BIG-IP AS3 adjusts the send buffer size automatically to optimize throughput

closeWaitTimeout.title: Close-wait timeout
closeWaitTimeout.description: Number of seconds (default 5) connection will remain in LAST-ACK state before exiting.  Value -1 means indefinite, limited by maximum retransmission timeout

congestionControl.title: Congestion-control algorithm
congestionControl.description: Selects TCP congestion-control algorithm (default 'woodside'). The bbr option is available on BIGIP 14.1 and above.

congestionMetricsCache.title: Congestion metrics cache
congestionMetricsCache.description: If true (default), the system may cache congestion metrics to inform the congestion control algorithm

congestionMetricsCacheTimeout.title: Congestion metrics cache timeout
congestionMetricsCacheTimeout.description: Number of seconds for which entries in the congestion metrics cache are valid (default 0 means use system default)

deferredAccept.title: Deferred accept
deferredAccept.description: If true, ADC will defer allocating resources to a connection until some payload data has arrived from the client (default false).  This may help minimize the impact of certain DoS attacks but adds undesirable latency under normal conditions.  Note:  'deferredAccept' is incompatible with server-speaks-first application protocols

delayedAcks.title: Delayed ACKs
delayedAcks.description: If true (default), the system may coalesce multiple adjacent ACK responses

delayWindowControl.title: Delay-window control
delayWindowControl.description: If true, BIG-IP AS3 uses queueing delay as well as packet loss to estimate congestion (default false)

dsack.title: Use D-SACK
dsack.description: If true, BIG-IP AS3 uses rfc2883 duplicate selective-acknowledgements extension (default false).  Do not enable this option unless you are certain all peers support D-SACK

earlyRetransmit.title: Early retransmit
earlyRetransmit.description: If true (default), BIG-IP AS3 uses rfc5827 Early Retransmit recovery

ecn.title: Explicit congestion notification
ecn.description: If true (default), BIG-IP AS3 may send explicit congestion notification (ECN) flags (CWR, ECE) to peers

enhancedLossRecovery.title: Enhanced loss recovery
enhancedLossRecovery.description: If true (default), BIG-IP AS3 uses Selective ACK data to increase throughput

fastOpen.title: Fast-open
fastOpen.description: If true (default), the system can use the TCP Fast Open protocol extension to reduce latency by sending payload data with initial SYN

fastOpenCookieExpiration.title: Fast-open cookie expiration
fastOpenCookieExpiration.description: Sets maximum lifetime in seconds (default 21600 = six hours) of TCP Fast Open cookies

finWaitTimeout.title: FIN-WAIT timeout
finWaitTimeout.description: Number of seconds (default 5) connection will remain in FIN-WAIT-1 or closing state before exiting.  Value -1 means indefinite, limited by maximum retransmission timeout

finWait2Timeout.title: FIN-WAIT-2 timeout
finWait2Timeout.description: Number of seconds (default 300) connection will remain in LAST-ACK state before closing.  Value -1 means indefinite, limited by maximum retransmission timeout

idleTimeout.title: Idle timeout
idleTimeout.description: Number of seconds (default 300; may not be 0) connection may remain idle before it becomes eligible for deletion.  Value -1 (not recommended) means infinite

initCwnd.title: Initial congestion-window size
initCwnd.description: Sets the initial congestion-window size (default 16) in multiples of MSS (not in octets)

initRwnd.title: Initial receive-window size
initRwnd.description: Sets the initial receive-window size (default 16) in multiples of MSS (not in octets)

ipDfMode.title: IP DF mode
ipDfMode.description: Controls DF (Don't Fragment) flag in outgoing packets.  Value 'pmtu' (default) sets DF based on IP PMTU value.  Value 'preserve' copies DF from received packets.  Value 'set' forces DF true in all outgoing packets.  Value 'clear' forces DF false in all outgoing packets

ipTosToClient.title: IP DSCP (TOS) to client
ipTosToClient.description: Specifies the IP DSCP/TOS value in packets sent to clients (default 0).  Numeric values in this property are decimal representations of eight-bit numbers, of which the leftmost six bits are the DSCP per rfc2474 (and the system uses the rightmost two bits for congestion signaling when 'ecn' is true).  You may have to calculate the value of this property by multiplying a DSCP code, such as CS5+EF = 46, by four to obtain the proper 'ipTosToClient' value, such as 184.  Value 'pass-through' sets DSCP from the initial server-side value.  Value 'mimic' copies DSCP from the most-recently received server-side packet (allowing DSCP to vary during the life of a connection)

keepAliveInterval.title: Keep-alive interval
keepAliveInterval.description: Number of seconds (default 1800) between keep-alive probes

limitedTransmit.title: Limited transmit recovery
limitedTransmit.description: When true (default), the system can use rfc3042 limited transmit recovery scheme

linkQosToClient.title: Link QOS to client
linkQosToClient.description: Specifies the Layer-2 QOS code in packets sent to clients (default 0).  Ethernet-type networks recognize codes from 0 to 7.  Value 'pass-through' sets QOS from the initial server-side value

maxRetrans.title: Maximum segment retransmissions
maxRetrans.description: Sets maximum number of times the system may retransmit a segment (default 8)

maxSegmentSize.title: MSS
maxSegmentSize.description: Sets MSS advertised to peer.  Value 0 (default) will set MSS automatically in proportion to interface MTU.  Default 0 is usually the best choice

md5Signature.title: MD5 signatures
md5Signature.description: If true, the system signs TCP headers using MD5 per rfc2385 (default false)

md5SignaturePassphrase.title: MD5 passphrase
md5SignaturePassphrase.description: Passphrase from which the system derives the key for MD5 signatures (MACs) when 'md5signature' is true

allowReuse.description: If true, other declaration objects may reuse this value

mptcp.title: Multipath TCP (MPTCP)
mptcp.description: Value 'disable' (default) excludes use of Multipath TCP (MPTCP) through virtual server.  Value 'enable' means virtual server will accept and participate in MPTCP connections.  Value 'passthrough' means MPTCP packets may pass through virtual server

mptcpCsum.title: MPTCP checksums
mptcpCsum.description: If true, the system calculates MPTCP checksums (default false)

mptcpCsumVerify.title: MPTCP checksum verify
mptcpCsumVerify.description: If true, the system verifies MPTCP checksums (default false)

mptcpFallback.title: MPTCP fallback action
mptcpFallback.description: Selects action on fallback from MPTCP to ordinary TCP

mptcpFastJoin.title: MPTCP fast join
mptcpFastJoin.description: If true, the system may send data with MP_JOIN SYN packet, reducing connection latency (default false)

mptcpIdleTimeout.title: Idle timeout
mptcpIdleTimeout.description: Number of seconds (default 300) connection may remain idle before it becomes eligible for deletion

mptcpJoinMax.title: MPTCP join maximum
mptcpJoinMax.description: Limit on number of subflows which the system may add to the MPTCP connection (default 5)

mptcpMakeAfterBreak.title: MPTCP make-after-break
mptcpMakeAfterBreak.description: If true, the system can add additional subflows during the 'mptcpTimeout' period, even if the ADC is not currently handling an active connection (default false)

mptcpNoJoinDssAck.title: MPTCP fast join
mptcpNoJoinDssAck.description: If true, no DSS option will sent with MP_JOIN ACK packet (default false)

mptcpRtoMax.title: MPTCP RTO maximum
mptcpRtoMax.description: Maximum number of retransmission timeouts which may occur before the system declares a subflow dead

mptcpRetransmitMin.title: MPTCP retransmit timer
mptcpRetransmitMin.description: Minimum value in milliseconds (default 1000) of MPTCP retransmission timer

mptcpSubflowMax.title: MPTCP subflow maximum
mptcpSubflowMax.description: Maximum number of subflows per connection (default 6)

mptcpTimeout.title: MPTCP timeout
mptcpTimeout.description: Number of seconds (default 3600) after which the system may expunge an MPTCP session with no active flow

nagle.title: Nagle's algorithm
nagle.description: Value 'enable' means to use Nagle's algorithm to minimize the transmission of short TCP segments (note:  Nagle's algorithm yields undesirable results with many application protocols).  Value 'auto' (default) means the ADC will choose automatically whether to enable Nagle's algorithm.  Value 'disable' averts application of Nagle's algorithm

pktLossIgnoreBurst.title: Packet loss ignore burst
pktLossIgnoreBurst.description: Modulates use of congestion control when losing multiple packets.  Value 0 (default) means to perform congestion control if any packet loss occurs.  Higher values increase tolerance for lost packets before signaling congestion

pktLossIgnoreRate.title: Packet loss ignore rate
pktLossIgnoreRate.description: Sets threshold of packet loss rate (lost-packets/million-packets) above which the system performs congestion control.  Value 0 (default) means to perform congestion control if any packet loss occurs.  Higher values increase tolerance for lost packets before signaling congestion

proxyBufferHigh.title: Proxy-buffer high
proxyBufferHigh.description: The system closes the receive window when the number of octets in proxy buffer rises above this value

proxyBufferLow.title: Proxy-buffer low
proxyBufferLow.description: The system opens the receive window when the number of octets in proxy buffer falls below this value

proxyMSS.title: Proxy MSS
proxyMSS.description: If true (default), the MSS value advertised on the server side will match that negotiated with the client, if permitted by MTU and other constraints

proxyOptions.title: Proxy options
proxyOptions.description: If true, TCP options such as timestamp advertised on the server side will match those negotiated with client (default false)

pushFlag.title: PuSH flag control
pushFlag.description: Controls when ADC sets PSH flag in outbound TCP segments.  Limiting the sending of segments with PSH improves performance.  Value 'auto' (recommended) sets PSH according to a system algorithm optimal in most cases.  Value 'default' (not recommended) sets the PUSH flag in every segment which happens to empty the send buffer.  Value 'none' prevents use of the PSH flag, and 'one' means the system sets PSH only when FIN is, at the end of a connection

ratePace.title: Rate pace
ratePace.description: If true (default), system will automatically pace rate of data transmission to optimize throughput

ratePaceMaxRate.title: Rate pace maximum rate
ratePaceMaxRate.description: Limit maximum data-transmission rate in octets/second to this value when 'ratePace' is true.  Default 0 means choose maximum rate automatically

receiveWindowSize.title: Receive-window size
receiveWindowSize.description: Maximum size of receive window (octets, default 131072)

resetOnTimeout.title: Reset on timeout
resetOnTimeout.description: If true (default), connections which time out will be reset (that is, the system will send an RST packet to the peer) before the system expunges them.  Value false is not recommended

retransmitThreshold.title: Retransmit threshold
retransmitThreshold.description: Specifies the number of duplicate ACKs to start fast recovery

selectiveAcks.title: Selective ACKs
selectiveAcks.description: If true (default), the system negotiates rfc2018 Selective Acknowledgements with peers

selectiveNack.title: Selective NAK
selectiveNack.description: If true, the system negotiates Selective Negative Acknowledgements with peers (default false)

sendBufferSize.title: Send-buffer size
sendBufferSize.description: Maximum size of send buffer (octets, default 262144)

slowStart.title: Slow-start
slowStart.description: If true (default), BIG-IP AS3 adjusts the initial window size per rfc3390.  This generally makes connections start more quickly, NOT more slowly

synCookieEnable.title: SYN cookie enable
synCookieEnable.description: If true (default), the system may use SYN cookies to avert connection-table overflow (for example, from DoS attacks)

synCookieAllowlist.title: SYN cookie allowlist
synCookieAllowlist.description: If true, after a client responds successfully to a SYN cookie challenge, the system accepts additional connection requests from that client without challenge for 30 seconds.

synCookieWhitelist.title: SYN cookie whitelist
synCookieWhitelist.description: Deprecated.  Replaced with functionally equivalent synCookieAllowlist.  If true, after a client responds successfully to a SYN cookie challenge, the system accepts additional connection requests from that client without challenge for 30 seconds.

synMaxRetrans.title: Maximum SYN retransmissions
synMaxRetrans.description: Maximum number of times the system retransmits a SYN when it does not receive a SYN+ACK (default 3)

synRtoBase.title: SYN RTO base
synRtoBase.description: Number of milliseconds (default 3000) to which the system initially sets the SYN retransmission timer.  The system adjusts the timer after each retransmission to implement binary-exponential-backoff

tailLossProbe.title: Tail loss probe
tailLossProbe.description: If true (default), the system uses the Tail Loss Probe scheme to reduce retransmission timeouts

tcpOptions.title: TCP options capture for iRules
tcpOptions.description: Selects which TCP Option values the system captures for reference by iRules

option.title: Number
option.description: Specifies the TCP option to capture

when.title: When seen
when.description: Specifies when to capture the TCP option

timestamps.title: Timestamps
timestamps.description: If true (default and recommended), BIG-IP AS3 enables rfc1323 timestamps

timeWaitRecycle.title: TIME-WAIT recycle
timeWaitRecycle.description: If true (default), the system reuses connection resources immediately when it receives a SYN during the TIME-WAIT period

timeWaitTimeout.title: Time-wait timeout
timeWaitTimeout.description: Number of milliseconds (default 2,000) connection will remain in TIME-WAIT state before closing.  Value -1 means indefinite

ttlMode.title: TTL mode
ttlMode.description: Controls IP TTL in outgoing packets.  Value 'set' forces TTL to value of property 'ttlIPv4' or 'ttlIPv6' as appropriate.  Value 'proxy' (default) forces TTL to the default value for IPv4 or IPv6 as appropriate.  Value 'preserve' copies TTL from received packet.  Value 'decrement' sets TTL to one less than received packet's TTL

ttlIPv4.title: TTL for IPv4
ttlIPv4.description: TTL the system sets in outgoing IPv4 packets

ttlIPv6.title: TTL for IPv6
ttlIPv6.description: TTL the system sets in outgoing IPv6 packets

verifiedAccept.title: Verified accept
verifiedAccept.description: If true, the system must establish a server-side connection before a it accepts a corresponding client-side connection (default false).  Value 'true' is incompatible with iRules

zeroWindowTimeout.title: Zero-window timeout
zeroWindowTimeout.description: Number of milliseconds (default 20,000) connection will persist with window-size of zero (effective timeout is value rounded up to the nearest multiple of 5000).  Value -1 means indefinite

parentProfile.description: Specifies the name of the object to inherit the settings from

Radius_Profile.title: Radius_Profile
Radius_Profile.description: Configures a RADIUS profile for network traffic load balancing

parentProfile.description: Specifies the name of the object to inherit the settings from

persistAttribute.description: Specifies the name of the RADIUS attribute on which traffic persists. Acceptable values are ASCII strings from section 5 of RFC 2865 or numeric codes (1-255). A value of none indicates that persistence is disabled.

protocolProfile.description: Specifies PEM protocol profile that defines mapping of RADIUS AVPs to subscriber ID and other PEM subscriber session attributes

subscriberDiscoveryEnabled.description: Specifies whether to enable PEM subscriber discovery based on the content of RADIUS packets

IP_Other_Profile.title: IP_Other_Profile
IP_Other_Profile.description: Configures a generic IP profile for non-TCP and non-UDP traffic

parentProfile.description: Specifies the name of the object to inherit the settings from

idleTimeout.description: Specifies the number of seconds a connection can be idle before the connection is eligible for deletion
idleTimeout.$comment: It might be possible to specify a value of 0 and remove the immediate option

Label.title: Label
Label.description: Optional friendly name for this object. Allows 0-64 chars, excluding a few likely to cause trouble with string searching, JS, TCL, or HTML

Remark.title: Remark
Remark.description: Arbitrary (brief) text pertaining to this object. Allows 0-64 chars, excluding only control characters, double-quote, and backslash.  This is permissive enough that you should worry about XSS attacks

F5base64.description: Slightly over-matches both base64-orig and base64-url data

F5string.title: String value
F5string.description: String value optionally in base64 or from URL or BIG-IP AS3 pointer

copyFrom.title: Copy from
copyFrom.description: BIG-IP AS3 pointer to declaration object/property from which to copy value

bigip.title: BIG-IP component pathname
bigip.description: Pathname of existing BIG-IP component

Metadata.title: Metadata
Metadata.description: Useful datapoints for tracking, tagging, and organizing declarations.
Metadata.$comment: Properties are arbitrarily set by the user.

bypassList.description: List of URIs that are bypassed in a web page when a rewrite mode of portal is used

clientCachingType.description: The type of client caching used

javaCaFile.description: The CA Bundle used to verify Java applets signature certificates

javaSignKeyPassphrase.description: Passphrase if any for query authentication

allowReuse.description: If true, other declaration objects may reuse this value

certificate.description: BIG-IP AS3 pointer to client Certificate declaration (optional)

locationSpecificEnabled.description: Specifies if this contains an attribute with values specific to the location that the BIG-IP device resides

requestSettings.description: The request settings used for uri-translation

responseSettings.description: The response settings used for uri-translation

rewriteList.description: List of URIs that are rewritten inside a web page when a rewrite mode of portal is used

rewriteMode.description: The mode of rewriting that is used.uri-translation is a rules-based rewrite mode. portal is for use with Portal Access

setCookieRules.description: The rules for rewriting HTTP Set-Cookie headers. Used with a rewrite mode of uri-translation

splitTunnelingEnabled.description: Determines if the profile provides for split tunneling

uriRules.description: The rules for rewriting request and response headers and response bodies. Used with a rewrite mode of uri-translation

path.description: The path of the client. Must be an absolute directory path
The path of the server. Must be an absolute directory path

type.description: The type of rule. request will affect request headers only, response will affect response headers and bodies, and both will do request and response

scheme.description: The scheme of the client URI

host.description: The host of the client URI

port.description: The port of the client URI

path.description: The path of the client URI. Must be an absolute directory path

scheme.description: The scheme of the server URI

host.description: The host of the server URI

port.description: The port of the server URI

path.description: the path of the server URI. Must be an absolute directory path

rewriteHeadersEnabled.description: Determines if request headers are rewritten

rewriteContentEnabled.description: Determines if response content should be rewritten

rewriteHeadersEnabled.description: Determines if response headers should be rewritten

parentProfile.description: Specifies the profile that this profile will inherit values from

chunkingEnabled.description: Specifies that incoming data should be parsed in chunks

chunkSize.description: The maximum size that a parsed chunk can be

target.description: Specifies the new string that will replace the source string

url.title: URL
url.description: The URL to pull the Access Profile from

ssloCreated.title: SSL Orchestrator Created
ssloCreated.description: Set to true if the profile was created by SSL Orchestrator. If true the non-configurable Kerberos Request-Based Authentication (/Common/rba) and WebSSO (/Common/websso) profiles will not be attached to Services when this profile is attached

ignoreChanges.title: Ignore changes
ignoreChanges.description: If false (default), the system updates the profile in every BIG-IP AS3 declaration deployment. If true, BIG-IP AS3 creates the profile on first deployment, and leaves it untouched afterwards. However, if enable is set to true, the policy will be applied even if ignoreChanges is true

enable.title: Enable
enable.description: Apply the profile after updating it. If false (default), the system only updates the profile. Also note 'ignoreChanges'.

Per_Request_Access_Policy.title: Per_Request_Access_Policy
Per_Request_Access_Policy.description: Configures a Per Flow Request Access Policy

url.title: URL
url.description: The URL to pull the policy from

ignoreChanges.title: Ignore changes
ignoreChanges.description: If false (default), the system updates the profile in every BIG-IP AS3 declaration deployment. If true, BIG-IP AS3 creates the profile on first deployment, and leaves it untouched afterwards

uri.description: Specifies the absolute URI that contains both the complete hostname and the path of the resource to use in the ICAP header. Macro expansion is supported for all attribute values in the ICAP header (e.g. icap://${SERVER_IP}:${SERVER_PORT}/videoOptimization)

fromHeader.description: Specifies the 'From' attribute to use in the ICAP header

hostHeader.description: Specifies the 'Host' attribute to use in the ICAP header

refererHeader.description: Specifies the 'Referer' attribute to use in the ICAP header

userAgentHeader.description: Specifies the 'User-Agent' attribute to use in the ICAP header

previewLength.description: Specifies the length of the preview in the transaction

Adapt_Profile.title: Adapt_Profile
Adapt_Profile.description: Configures a request or response Adapt profile or both

messageType.description: The type of Adapt profile. Use both to create a request and response profile with the same property values

enableHttpAdaptation.description: Enable or disable the adaptation of HTTP requests/responses. They will be forwarded to the internal service

internalService.description: Specifies the name of the internal service to use for adapting the request/response

previewSize.description: Specifies the maximum size of the preview buffer

serviceDownAction.description: Specifies the action to take if the internal service doesn't exist or is down

timeout.description: Specifies how long in miliseconds to wait for the internal service before a timeout error will occur

allowHTTP10.description: Specifies whether to forward HTTP 1.0 requests/responses

namedGroups.description: Specifies the Elliptic Curve Diffie Hellman key agreement algorithms used to negotiate SSL/TLS connections. namedGroups are only supported on BIG-IP 14.0 and later.

signatureAlgorithms.description: Specifies the digital signature algorithms used for authentication. signatureAlgorithms are only supported on BIG-IP 14.0 and later.

order.description: Configure the order of the specified Cipher Rules.

excludeCipherRules.description: Exclude the following Cipher_Rules from the Allowed list.

requireCipherRules.description: Restrict the Allowed list to the following Cipher_Rules.
